page.title: 08Finedon Memories of 1945
page.content: We talked to a lady who had lived in Finedon for 72years.She told us about life in 1945.Food was rationed,Old Joe's Cough Drops,from the market,were the only unrationed sweets.When her daughter was given a banana she didn't know how to eat it. In 1945 most houses did not have a bathroom and so you had an "up and downer" instead i.e. you washed yourself all over top-to-toe from a bowl.Floors were covered in linoleum and rag rugs.There was no running hot water and few inside lavatories. In Finedon there used to be 4 schools, now there are only 2, as secondary children go out of town and the junior schools have amalgamated. Her first T.V was bought in 1953 for the Queen's coronation.It showed black and white pictures on a 9 inch screen.
